IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE MISSION OF GREATER GALLATIN UNITED WAY IS TO IMPROVE LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF COMMUNITIES. ALL PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES PROVIDE HUMAN SERVICES FOR THE PEOPLE OF GALLATIN, PARK , MADISON, AND MEAGHER COUNTIES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF GREATER GALLATIN UNITED WAY IS TO IMPROVE LIVES BY MOBILIZING THE CARING POWER OF COMMUNITIES. ALL PROGRAMS AND INITIATIVES PROVIDE HUMAN SERVICES FOR THE PEOPLE OF GALLATIN, PARK , MADISON, AND MEAGHER COUNTIES.
IRS990.Description: KEEPING KIDS ON TRACK TO ACHIEVE THEIR POTENTIAL FOCUSES ON ENSURING THAT CHILDREN ARE READY TO LEARN WHEN ENTERING SCHOOL, THAT THEY ACCESS SAFE PLACES AND ENHANCEMENT ACTIVITIES IN OUT-OF-SCHOOL-TIME AND THAT THEIR FAMILIES HAVE SUPPORT AND TRAINING TO BE ENGAGED IN CREATING THAT SUCCESS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS CREATED AN INITIATIVE WITH 21 SCHOOL-BASED SITES TO PROVIDE AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMMING, IS ENGAGED IN EARLY LEARNING ACTIVITIES, AND IS FUNDING PROGRAMS THAT BUILD ON FAMILY STRENGTH AND OTHERS THAT ADVOCATE FOR THE WELL-BEING OF CHILDREN.

Activity2.Description: CONNECTING VOLUNTEERS TO COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE ORGANIZATION EXECUTIVE SPENDS SIGNIFICNT TIME ACTING AS A RESOURCE, FACILITATOR, TRAINER AND CAPACITY BUILDER FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS, NONPROFITS, BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONAL ENTITIES. THE EXECUTIVE AND STAFF CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION IN VARIOUS FORMATS ON IMPORTANT HUMAN SERVICES ISSUES RELATING TO HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND INCOME. ASSESSMENTS, SURVEYS, AND FOCUS GROUPS ARE CONDUCTED TO DETERMINE PRIORITIZATION OF HUMAN SERVICE NEEDS AND INFORMATION IS COMMUNICATED TO THE PUBLIC.

Activity3.Description: IMPROVING PEOPLE'S FINANCIAL STABILITY TO STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES FOCUSES ON ENSURING THAT PEOPLE CAN MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE THEIR CIRCUMSTANCES. THE ORGANIZATION INVESTS IN PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE BASIC NEEDS FOR INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES, IS ENGAGED IN WORKING WITH COALITIONS TO PREVENT HOMELESSNESS, AND IN FUNDING PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE TOOLS AND SUPPORT FOR PEOPLE TO IMPROVE THEIR OWN SELF-SUFFICIENCY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE POSTED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE AND HARD COPIES ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION POLICY IS INCLUDED IN THE ANNUAL ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL POLICIES WHICH IS REVISITED BY THE BOARD EACH YEAR.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CODE OF ETHICS POLICY IS REVIEWED AND SIGNED BY EACH BOARD MEMBER AND STAFF ANNUALLY. FURTHER MONITORED DURING THE YEAR THROUGH CONSTANT COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE CEO AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: FINANCE AND AUDIT COMMITTEE THOROUGHLY REVIEW AND MAKE A RECOMMENDATION FOR THE BOARD TO APPROVE PRIOR TO FILING. ADDITIONALLY, THE FULL BOARD REVIEWED THE 990.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d : Other Program Services Description
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: CONNECTING VOLUNTEERS TO COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE ORGANIZATION EXECUTIVE SPENDS SIGNIFICNT TIME ACTING AS A RESOURCE, FACILITATOR, TRAINER AND CAPACITY BUILDER FOR COMMUNITY MEMBERS, NONPROFITS, BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONAL ENTITIES. THE EXECUTIVE AND STAFF CONDUCT COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION IN VARIOUS FORMATS ON IMPORTANT HUMAN SERVICES ISSUES RELATING TO HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND INCOME. ASSESSMENTS, SURVEYS, AND FOCUS GROUPS ARE CONDUCTED TO DETERMINE PRIORITIZATION OF HUMAN SERVICE NEEDS AND INFORMATION IS COMMUNICATED TO THE PUBLIC.
